dcterms:creator: A. W. Moore
dcterms:description: The Mountain Car Control Problem involves a car placed at the bottom of a sinusoidal valley, which must be accelerated to reach the goal state at the top of the hill. The problem is characterized by continuous state and action spaces, making standard Q-learning approaches impractical.
dcterms:title: Mountain Car Control Problem

dcterms:creator: A. W. Moore
dcterms:description: The Van Der Pol Oscillator is a nonlinear oscillator that incorporates an external control input affecting its velocity. The goal is to stabilize the system at the origin by minimizing the deviation from desired position and velocity.
dcterms:title: Van Der Pol Oscillator
